text: Although IFN - 3 mRNA was upregulated in a few samples , neither of the JEV strains induced a statistically significant increase in expression for this gene at the investigated time points , suggesting an impact of JEV infection on the IFN pathway response ( Fig . 4C ) . It has been described that suppressor of cytokine signaling 1 ( SOCS1 ) , a negative regulator of IFN responses , is upregulated in cells infected by JEV ( 36 ) . Interestingly , 48 to 72 hpi both JEV strains induced a significant upregulation of SOCS1 in NEC , with higher gene expression in Laos - infected cells ( Fig . 4D ) .
